channel.title: How do I make a video collection similar to this?
channel.description:
I dont know if its realy a collection, more like a log or something....
[url=http://www.basilmarket.com/window-video.php]http://www.basilmarket.com/window-video.php[/url]

item.title: How do I make a video collection similar to this?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

goatee:

I would have to say they are different. Php is more for databases and stuff lime that. I use js for visual effects.

Yea thanks. I realize that, but many times, php can do stuff js can do, and vice versa.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make a video collection similar to this?
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:39, topic:126870”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=177489.msg1630197#msg1630197 date=1185516833]

combining those two should work, but im not real good with JS, is anyone here willing to help?

I hate js with a passion. I prefer php.
[/quote]

I would have to say they are different. Php is more for databases and stuff lime that. I use js for visual effects.[/quote]
PHP is Server scripting. Javascript is browser scripting. They do different stuff.

item.title: How do I make a video collection similar to this?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:15, topic:126870”][quote author=raindropsc link=topic=177489.msg1630186#msg1630186 date=1185516653]
combining those two should work, but im not real good with JS, is anyone here willing to help?
[/quote]

I hate js with a passion. I prefer php.[/quote]

I would have to say they are different. Php is more for databases and stuff lime that. I use js for visual effects.

item.title: How do I make a video collection similar to this?
item.dc:creator: @raindropsc raindropsc
item.description:
@raindropsc wrote:

so the final thing should be:

<select size="16" name="monster" onChange="window.location='http://www.site.com/videos.php?area_id='+this.value;" style="width:100%;background:#fff;">
<optgroup label="Option Labels">
<option value="3132">Video Name</option>
<option value="5646">Video Name</option>
</optgroup>
</select>
<?php
$id = $_GET['area_id']
$connection = mysql_connect("localhost", "root", "password") or die("Error connecting to database");
mysql_select_db("auths", $connection);
$result = mysql_query("SELECT * FROM vids WHERE id=$_GET['area_id']", $connection) or die("error querying database");
while($row = mysql_fetch_row($result)){
switch($row['$id']){
case '3132'
echo $row['3132'];
break;
case
......
}
?>

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make a video collection similar to this?
item.dc:creator: @raindropsc raindropsc
item.description:
@raindropsc wrote:

im not that good with MySQL, corrct me if im wrong, it would be like this

<?php
$id = $_GET['area_id']
$connection = mysql_connect("localhost", "root", "password") or die("Error connecting to database");
mysql_select_db("auths", $connection);
$result = mysql_query("SELECT * FROM vids WHERE id=$_GET['area_id']", $connection) or die("error querying database");
$query = while($row = mysql_fetch_row($result)){
switch(id){
$row['$id'];
}
}
echo $query;
?>

item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

xxlegitxx:

That’s fine if you want an array, but you want actual data from one specific cell, you’ll need to specify which column to pick it from.

no matter what it returns an array
just the array would only have 1 value

item.dc:creator: @raindropsc raindropsc
item.description:

despending on the URL, it should load the rowid.
so if the URL is http://site.com/321.php?area_id=321
it would load the contents of row 321 from database ‘auths’, table ‘vids’

item.title: How do I make a video collection similar to this?
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

onChange=“window.location='http://www.basilmarket.com/window-video.php?area_id=’+this.value;”

is js

as for the php backend
it reloads the page with the new embed information
there are a couple of ways to achive this
create an array with the values using the id in the url

array{
[0]=>video0
[1]=>video1
}

moe likely its mysql and it uses a rowid number as the id for the file
and it just does a query by the $_GET for the embed
as for the list its proboly just a SELECT * FROM ‘movies’ or something and it just loops through the information echoing it out

its rather easy but im not gonna code it for u

Read full topic
